reviewText: One of my favorites in the Firm Series.  Best 30 minute workout for the hips, thighs and abs.  You definitely feel the burn during workout and next day.  Very effective, gets the job done saw visible results in more toned thighs and abs.  Excellent target training DVD in this Series.
summary: Fantastic moves to more toned abs and thighs

reviewText: This was a really good lower body workout in less time.You have to make sure you have the sculpting stick.It uses it a lot in this video.You need one pair of dumbells for this about 3-8 pounds depending on how strong you are and you will need bench or something to lie on while doing intense leg toning,The ab part is really intense using the sculpting stick my abs were burning after this video.If you have all the equipment it uses will love it.Pam Cauthen from Firm Strength returns in this video,I was really happy to see her back.She is a really good instructer from another one of my favorite Firms.This tape is only for Firm believers.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Pam Cauthen Meriwether leads this great toning DVD. It is divided into two sections. The first leads you through a series of hip and thigh exercises. There is a lot of variety in this segment - you'll work on the floor, on top of your step, and on an incline. This is definitely challenging and had me sweating.The abs section is even more challenging. The work on the incline is very advanced, although there are beginner modifications you can make. This is a workout that I will have to grow into.In order to do all of the exercises as demonstrated, you will need the new firm box or a step that adjusts to 14" and an incline. The sculpting stick and a set of dumbbells are also used. If you didn't have the sculpting stick, you could use dumbbells or even a broom stick.
Title: N/A

reviewText: For the most part, the exercises on this video are fantastic - they intensely work the target muscles.  Some of the exercises are new and unique, others are old favorites.However, I feel the special props (the bench and "sculpting stick") they recommend aren't necessary and are actually distracting; I was able to do all the exercises with a stool and/or couch and free weights or ankle weights.  Also, I personally felt that this instructor and the music are very annoying (I'm usually not picky about music and can tolerate cheesiness, but this sounded like home made midi techno).  Aside from those objections, I would recommend this video because it is a solid workout.Personally I like 2 other Firm videos that also work the legs on the floor (i.e. no jumps, no squats) more than this one.Firm Total Body: Abs Hips & Thighs SculptingThe Firm: Sculpted Buns, Hips, and ThighsEven though these "classic" videos have old school music, the exercises are effective, and you don't have to deal with special props.The exercises I like on this Fast & Firm Sculpting video that are "new" and not on the classic videos I listed above are*Elbows on stool or couch and legs in front, LIFT one leg and do leg circles.*BRIDGE lifts with legs on stool.*Outer thigh side leg lefts while in table position on top of the box*Plank work(Of course there are other exercises I liked, but they are old time favorites like inner thigh lift, table work, reverse crunches, etc)
summary: Good exercises, but I like 2 older videos more than this one

reviewText: Watch out!! I bought the firm box system and I got this dvd as the bonus. Although, the name of the one I got was "Hips, thighs & Abs" and the cover is white but it is the same workout as this one!!!!! Only difference is that the one included with the system was divided into 2 chapters, hips/thighs and abs. This one is not chaptered.But despite that confusion, this is a great workout, it hurts, it is a lot of work for the legs, specially the thighs!Not much cardio, but toning is great!
summary: Watch out!! sold as fast and firm, and as bonus in BSS3!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD requires a Firm Step with incline and the sculpting stick.  I didn't have a sculpting stick, but managed to make it work with dumbells.  It's a quick workout that gets your muscles pretty warm, but I didn't really sweat at all (and I only consider myself to be an intermediate exerciser).  Also, some of the exercises require you to lay on or lean on the step in ways that I found outrageously uncomfortable and was forced to move to the floor.  The abs section is TOUGH and the cueing by the instructor is very good throughout.  Also, (and yes, I know it's not in the title, but...)it would have been nice to have a short upper body segment as well.  I'll use it, but not as often as my other Firm DVDs.
summary: I'm still not sure how I feel about this one!

reviewText: When I first put this in my DVD player, I had to fast forward through several minutes of Firm ads.  Then, I realized that I needed a Firm step and a weighted bar.  (You could use a Pilates box, or a high step bench, and dumbbells, so I think the need for equipment is not insurmountable, if you have some other exercise equipment around.)  Then, the first opening shots started, and I had the immediate negative reaction I have to standard aerobics filming techniques, "Oh no.  This is going to be hard to watch."I was wrong, though.  The lighting is bright enough, and there was some set design in terms of moving green lights behind abstract panels.  The instructor seems like your typical 'strong Southern woman', which, if you like that sort of thing, is a real plus.  Having gotten past my initial negative first impression, I settled in to work out.Then the music started.  Bad, bad, bad.  It reminded me of the Soviet-era synthesizer music I brought home from pre-Wall-falling Romania during a Youth Orchestra tour in 1985.  (Apologies to the Soviets.)  The music is so unlistenable that I couldn't watch the rest of the DVD.This would be good, if not for the music.  If you are bothered by bad music, buy something else.
summary: Needs too much extra equipment; bad music.

reviewText: The Firm has released a small amount of lower body floorwork videos, I have to say this one is my favorite.  Pam Cauthen Meriwether leads this 35 minute workout that is an add on from the Firm BSS3 workout system.  She is joined by 4 fellow Firm Master Instructors, with Libby as the beginner modifier.  You will need a set of dumbells anywhere from 3-8 lbs depending on your level.  The Firm Box and Sculpting Stick are also used but the workout can be done without it.You start with a warmup, which is done in bare feet which I thought was odd at first, shoes can be worn if you wish.  I really like the music in the warmup.  Then it's on to leg work, starting with quadricep work.  You place your forearms on the box  keeping your hips lifted and do leg lifts, pulses and circles, much harder than it looks as you try to keep the hips lifted the whole time.  This can be be done seated as well.  Then you will go on your knees and hold the Sculpting Stick above your head and do hip tucks, again harder than it looks as the goal is to keep the hips lifted the whole time.The next segment is bridgework using weights, you prop one foot on the box then raise the other leg in the air and do hip raises, you repeat on the other leg then place both feet on the box and do more hip raises.  Then you go on top of the box for table work and do outer thigh lifts, starting with the leg bent, then straighten the leg to make it harder.  This felt awkward to me, next time I might just do it on the floor and use a bent leg, which is the beginner option.  Then you will work the inner thighs, laying on top of the box then take the Sculpting Stick and lay it on your leg and do inner thigh lifts & sweeps.  Laying on the box was not comfortable so I just did it on the floor, I might use a dumbell or ankle weight instead of the stick next time too. The inner thigh work is repeated on the other side before doing the outer thigh tablework on the opposite leg.More tablework using a weight is next, the incline box is also used here, again I just did this segment on the floor.  You work the hamstring with leg lifts then adding crossovers, then you will remove the weight, straighten the leg and repeat.  This is then repeated on the other leg.  Then you will work the outer thighs while lying on the incline box and do leg lifts, I also did this segment on the floor.  Then it's time to stretch.The ab section follows the lower body work, once again the incline box is used for a good part of it, which makes it quite challenging, but it can also be done on the floor.  First you start with planks, holding in the position then adding alternating knees working the obliques a bit, this is repeated a few times.  Then you will lie on the incline box and do lower crunches, adding leg extensions, leg walks and pulleys, this set goes on a while and you will really feel it.The second half of the abwork is done on the floor, using the disassembled Sculpting Stick.  You hold the twigs in your hands, and place the other section behind your knees.  You start with upper crunches, gradually adding lower crunches, then chest presses before going into ribcage pullovers, then you finish out with more upper and lower body crunches done individually but adding swivels to each side.Overall I really liked this routine, even with all the modifications I made to it.  Some people might get disgusted when purchasing this video and seeing all the equipment that is used with it, but you can do the routine without it.  I admire the Firm for finding new ways to incorporate the gadgets they invent into the workouts, but sometimes they tend to overdo it just a little.  And that's coming from a long time Firm fan.Pam does a great job instructing here, she is one of my favorite Firm instructors.  She is pleasant, encouraging and cues well.  A solid 4 stars for this one.
summary: Effective and unique lower body and ab routine...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Living in the middle of Europe and being keen on US home workout videos, I always order mine from Amazon and I usually refuse to do so when a video receives low rates - or no rates at all. However, it must have been the Christmas spirit, I decided to give this one a try - and made a mistake.The saying "less is sometimes more" is definitely right when it comes to this tape. I'm actually thinking of entirely giving up on the newer Firm tapes, since they seem to start using more and more fancy equipment making sure they include one of those "special offer" leaflets inside; you should feel lucky you've been given the chance at all. A true rip-off. They are using yet another type of a step-box kinda miracle here - no, it's not even the Fanny Lifter anymore, it's The Firm Box. Yay! And even though it only says on the cover you'll need a couple of dumbbells, they keep using some broomstick-like weight-thingy, too.Not only does the rip-off mentality make me sick, but so does the fact that while doing the exercises I was coming to realize that I didn't even need all that stuff after all.The instructor is terrible - the cueing is poor and I really thought the age of sickly skinny women looking like 12 year-old boys AND advertising fitness and a healthy way of life has long been over. This tape proves otherwise.The whole workout is about 30 minutes, including a warm-up and two streching sets - one after the lower body and another one after the abs workout. This latter one also goes to prove "less is sometimes more" - they seem to get so lost in different places to place different parts of that broomstick-like thing and including lower AND upper abs AND upper body exercises all in one breath that I found myself wondering what WAS going on after all.The reason I am still giving this tape two stars is that most of the lower body exercises are effective, even though I'm sure that everyone that's ever worked out has already been through all of them more than a few times. Most of them are those all-time favorites including mostly different types of leg-lifts.There are several great tapes out there - I'd recommend trying those with Minna Lessing or "Lift Weights To Lose Weight Part Two" by Cathy Smith, but DEFINITELY not this one!

reviewText: I love the firm and have been doing it since early 90's. I am in average condition although a little overweight right now. These is good for all levels. For advance it would be good for a short day or add on to other exercise. For beginners or intermediate exercise this dvd is good on its own. worked the lower half in different ways which made it fun and go by pretty fast! would recommend!
